page.title: 16Quaker Farm, Spixworth
page.content: 15000{hens} housed in warm conditions all year round, are brought to the point of laying and are kept for 15 months.Feed meal is mixed on farm. Each hen produces about 250 eggs per year. 20{pigs} are kept and fed on waste from the farm.The hen and cow slurry is added to "artificial" fertiliser. 260 acres of barley and wheat grown each year.Some barley is sold for malting, some on the farm. (Sugarbeet) 200 acres grown a year on British Sugar Corporation contract. The tops are winter fodder for cattle. Maize has been grown for 13 years and this is used to make silage for the cows. 230 acres of grass are grown. 70 acres of pasture hired in Summer {Irrigation}.1973 deep borehole sunk (30000 galls.per hour). 25,000 acres can be given the equivalent of 1" of rain in 24 hrs.
